{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hypoglycemia in newborns can be caused by several factors. Birth asphyxia can lead to hypoglycemia due to the increased metabolic demand and decreased glycogen stores. Respiratory distress syndrome can also lead to hypoglycemia due to the increased metabolic demand. Maternal diabetes can lead to hypoglycemia in the newborn due to hyperinsulinemia. However, post term infants are not particularly at risk for hypoglycemia. They have more mature systems and are able to regulate their blood sugar levels more effectively.", "answer_choice": "D. Post term infant"}
